newsitem.title: ITALY: Agip discovers more oil in Algeria deser.
newsitem.headline: Agip discovers more oil in Algeria deser.

text.p: Agip, the oil exploration and production arm of Italian energy group Eni, has discovered new oil reserves in Algeria, the company said in a statement.
It said tests showed the well could produce more than 12,000 barrels of oil a day.
The well was tapped in the Sahara desert, some 700 km south of Algiers. Agip said it had so far discovered seven oil wells in the region in conjunction with the Algerian state company Sonatrach.
"Three of these are already in production and currently provide some 50,000 barrels of oil a day," the statement said.
